body: Any updates regarding this issue? Or any workarounds?
As workaround you can add the header back with e.g. HTTP Sender script.

Apparently the 'If-None-Match' header is stripped before even arriving at the HTTP Sender script I wrote.
![image](https://github.com/zaproxy/zaproxy/assets/128834233/37639404-fd03-4a22-b666-7ed8ec374777)
![image](https://github.com/zaproxy/zaproxy/assets/128834233/a6ae81c5-ae03-46c4-9d4f-b75988c77a57)
Is there any other way to have the header back with its respective value?

Yes, that's why you need to add it back there.

I assumed you knew what message you wanted to change and the value to set. The Proxy script should allow you to get that info (along with global variables).

issue.title: Do not remove headers when proxying

repository.name: zaproxy
repository.description: The ZAP by Checkmarx Core project

issue.body:
Change the listener to no longer remove headers, if the client tool or user needs a fresh copy of the message they can do so themselves.

Fix #7353.

---
This behaviour was not documented, though it might affect the active scanner if the user scans 304 messages.

issue.title: network: add optional legacy core behaviour
issue.body:
Add legacy behaviour that removes the cache headers under an option, disabled by default.
Allow the user to restore the old undocumented behaviour while their setup is being corrected.

Part of zaproxy/zaproxy#7353.

body: This issue has been automatically locked since there has not been any recent activity after it was closed. Please open a new issue for related bugs.
